amendment.description: Amendment sought to strike the bill's reporting mandate on small businesses, terminate the Customer Due Diligence Rule, and require Treasury to conduct a study about all existing federal information databases available to law enforcement to discern the beneficial ownership of companies.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 5 printed in Part B of House Report 116-247 to strike the bill's reporting mandate on small businesses, terminates the Customer Due Diligence Rule, and requires Treasury to conduct a study about all existing federal information databases available to law enforcement to discern the beneficial ownership of companies.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Davidson (OH) amendment (A005) Failed by recorded vote: 166 - 258 (Roll no. 575).

action.text: House amendment offered/reported by: Amendment (A005) offered by Mr. Davidson (OH).
Amendment failed in Committee of the Whole
Roll call votes on amendments in House
House amendment not agreed to: On agreeing to the Davidson (OH) amendment (A005) Failed by recorded vote: 166 - 258 (Roll no. 575).
